newsitem.title: USA: World Airways says April block hours rises.
newsitem.headline: World Airways says April block hours rises.

text.p: World Airways Inc said Monday block hours flown for continuing operations rose about five percent in April to 4,299 from 4,079 in April 1996.
The carrier said the continuing operations represent contracts with international air carriers, the U.S. government, and international tour operators.
Average daily utilization rose to 10.2 block hours per day from 9.4 block hours per day in April of 1996, World Airways said.
Average aircraft units dropped to 14.0 from 14.4 in April 1996.
For the year-to-date ended April 30, block hours flown for continuing operations rose to 16,113 from 13,913 for the same period in 1996, an increase of approximately 16 percent.
Average daily utilization rose to 9.9 block hours per day from 9.8 block hours per day for the same period in 1996. Average aircraft units rose to 13.5 from 11.7 for the same period in 1996.
